review: Fire TV brought my LG smart TV and sound bar to life. Just another great Amazon electronic device and purchase.
author: Jones

review: I have a Roku and got this Amazon FIre TV and this is what I like and not so much likeWhat I like:* I like the voice search, screen saver, mirroring of Amazon Kindle or other Android Devices to TV.* I like the fast forward feature which is done really well.* Streaming seems to be really well done, I have not had any issues with network latency.* It is nice and compact, has great integration with Amazon Kindle HDX.* Screen saver is kind of cool and looks great on HD TV* Speed I love the response time of voice search and UI.* The weight, feel and quality of both the device and remote control.Not so much:* Although the user interface looks great, but I have issues accessing apps option (have to click so many time to get there)* Can not import apps from amazon (or at least I have not a way to do that yet) I would have liked to install coursera app on it.* Finding the last thing I was watching (last watched) is non-existent. So if I exit a movie I have to repeat all the steps I did to find it in first place unless I remember to tag it as add to watch-list* Exploring beyond what is recommended for Prime users can only be done with voice (for instance you have to say sci-fi prime to see those).* Sometime I want to watch something other what I usually do, but the interface focuses a lot on what historically the family watches) Would love to have the same kind of feature for genres.

review: Love this! Best purchase I've made in a long time. They've made it very easy for a prime customer to find content. Easy setup and simple remote. And I LOVE the voice search capability. I didn't think I'd use it, but I do all the time. Although, thinking a game controller should come with the device instead of a separate purchase, but overall satisfied.
